Exhibits and short video.                 NPS photo  Planning ahead can often make the difference between a good trip and a great trip to Richmond National Battlefield Park, a collection of 13 park units scattered across Hanover, Henrico, and Chesterfield counties and the city of Richmond. Explore these pages to discover the essential things you need to know before you leave home—how to get around the park, where pets are allowed, how to stay safe, and more.      Main Visitor Center   Tredegar Civil War Visitor Center Open 9am to 5pm 7 days a week GPS Address: 470 Tredegar Street  Richmond Virginia 23219   Battlefield Visitor Centers  (GPS Addresses) Cold Harbor Visitor Center  5515  Anderson-Wright Drive   Mechanicsville, Virginia 23111   (Open Daily 9am to 4:30pm)   Chimborazo Medical Museum   3215 East Broad Street   Richmond Virginia 23223  (Open Daily 9am to 4:30pm)   Fort Harrison Visitor Center 8621 Battlefield Park Road Richmond Virginia 23231 (open seasonally)  Glendale Visitor Center 8301 Willis Church Road  Richmond Virginia 23231 (open seasonally)       Operating Hours & Seasons Richmond National Battlefield Park has five Visitor Center locations. Tredegar Iron Works is open daily from 9-5, Chimborazo Medical Museum and Cold Harbor Visitor Center are open daily from 9-4:30, and the Fort Harrison and Glendale visitor centers are open seasonally.        Fees & Passes There are no entrance fees to Richmond National Battlefield Park sites. However there is a parking fee for the American Civil War Center at Tredegar Iron Works. Free parking is available nearby. The Interagency Annual Pass, Senior Pass and Access Pass can be obtained at the Civil War Visitor Center at Tredegar Iron Works (cash or check only.)
